title: Apex announces Comet satellite bus for constellations
summary:
Satellite manufacturer Apex has unveiled its largest spacecraft yet, a bus designed to serve commercial and government constellation customers.

title: How to capture Moon landing videos – from grainy to HD
summary: The next time astronauts land on the Moon, we will watch it in high-definition. The transmission will be in colour, digital and at up to 60 frames per second.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 27 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 launch from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center
summary: The Starlink 10-32 mission will see a Falcon 9 rocket fly in a north-easterly trajectory after launching from Launch Complex 39A at NASA's Kennedy Space Center. SpaceX is targeting a liftoff at 9:30 a.m. EDT (1330 UTC).

title: IFT-9 Is Another RUD for Starship, But An Improvement
summary: Starship’s ninth Integrated Flight Test (IFT-9) did not go as planned, but it got further than the last two attempts.  IFT-7 and IFT-8 exploded over the Caribbean.  IFT-9 made it […]

title: SpaceX launches first flight-proven Super Heavy booster, loses control of Starship mid-flight
summary: The mission saw the Block 2 version of the upper stage get further than the previous two flights, but the rocket succumbed to leaks that caused a loss of attitude control.

title: Starship breaks up on reentry after loss of attitude control
summary:
SpaceX’s Starship suffered a loss of attitude control after reaching space on its latest test flight May 27, leading to an uncontrolled reentry and a third consecutive failure.
The post Starship breaks up on reentry after loss of attitude control appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Elon Musk turns his focus back to space, says Starship and Mars matter most
summary: "Once you have the transportation system to Mars, then there's a vast set of opportunities."

title: NASA Interns Conduct Aerospace Research in Microgravity
summary: The NASA Science Activation program’s STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) Enhancement in Earth Science (SEES) Summer Intern Program, hosted by the University of Texas Center for Space Research, continues to expand opportunities for high school students to engage in authentic spaceflight research. As part of the SEES Microgravity Research initiative, four interns were selected […]
